This PR is rather lengthy as it updates all `DisplayData` consumers. I recommend starting with the following:
- [`DisplayDataTest#testTypicalUsage`](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/247/files#diff-dc3c5b91e4c8e5214d0db19b93d5b39aR84)
- Simplified [`DisplayData.Builder#add`](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/247/files#diff-703d3d7b0209b8b2c08c432d17024809R187) APIs
- New [`DisplayData#item`](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/247/files#diff-703d3d7b0209b8b2c08c432d17024809R603) factory methods

R: @kennknowles 

This is to ensure that elements don't get duplicated if, as part of #220 (and additional follow-up) a PTransform fails to process an element (due to some input not being ready) - it must schedule that element to be processed, but should not schedule it for any other consumer.

R: @tgroh 
R: @davorbonaci 

Perhaps just high level comments on the approach. Specifically, do you agree on this order of things:
1. Do this move now.
2. Leverage `TestPipeline` to immediately increase test coverage to include this runner.
3. Annotate tests appropriately with `NeedsRunner`
4. Delete `DirectPipelineRunner` from the SDK.

Expect some hiccups along the way. I'm sure that we will have to learn during set up of item 2, and that item 4 will feed back into item 3 since we will miss some.
LGTM
I've addressed all feedback so far. Please take another look. @bjchambers
LGTM

Yes, I think I agree with a few minor notes, such as separating into smaller PRs.

We may be able to avoid conflating addition of new code (e.g., `NeedsRunner`) with the move itself. Could be easier to review and reason about it that way. (This is particularly because I'm not sure all tests will actually work on the new runner right now -- they may soon.)

We should coordinate with pending PRs from @tgroh. I'm fine whichever order you decide to proceed in.

Note that the official name of the runner will be `DirectRunner`, without `Pipeline` or `InProcess`. Naming-wise, I'd probably go with:
- Directory: `/runners/direct-java`
- Artifact: `direct-runner`
- Java package: `org.apache.beam.runners.direct.*`

R: @davorbonaci

Done:
- Removed the not-yet-used `NeedsRunner` commit from this PR.
- Since that required a rebase, I also moved the commit on top of `apache/master`.
- Named directory, artifact, and package as you describe.

This commit is now strictly a move with a `pom.xml`. I don't think it is helpful to split this into two, since the dependency analysis requires the code to be in place to guide the `pom.xml`.

From here out, the changes will need tighter coordination to bring up the new runner with its appropriate name and running all the integration tests appropriately.
Replaces #249

R: @bjchambers
The description is a bit unclear -- please update. Also, this should probably have a test to verify proper behavior.

Fixed description, added comment.

The test is pretty complex, and I'm going to replace the update implementation with one that has a dedicated thread, and only on #extractFiredTimers; which will cause the test to no longer be particularly relevant.
Your intention is to resolve conflicts and overlay this on the new `CommittedResult` POJO, yes? If it isn't tremendously larger, feel free to combine this with an actual use of the new capability.
This can be closed with the merge of #260, which replaces it.

Actually, upon second thought;

Given that we are expected to reuse DoFns, this could fold in another change, and provide the ParDo to the evaluator as a ThreadLocal. Doing so gives a similar behavior (using ThreadLocal#initialValue()) instead of supplier.get(). That should get the same benefit (given that we only ever call supplier.get() once), but also enforce the requirement for DoFns to be used in a single thread, plus reuse.
Will go through your comments tomorrow Ken. Already proved very useful, thanks!
Thanks @swegner; looks great. I left two minor comments that might be good to address in a follow PR, if you agree with them. Sorry for not commenting on time.

Looks like this PR broke the build:
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_MavenVerify/303/console

(It seems it has raced with @swegner's merge.)

Can we get this forward-fixed?

The build-tool pom.xml should contains legal header. 
LGTM
LGTM

One little thought: if we are moving to one common `checkstyle.xml` then could it just be in the top-level parent project, which is the only place it is referenced? It took me a second to figure out what is going on with `sdks/java/build-tools`, since that module has nothing to do with SDKs.

It's what I'm planning once the checkstyle errors will be fixed (I'm working on it).

Actually, I plan to define some plugin by default, and a BOM for the dependencies. This is the first step.
I believe the decision of how and when to re-use a `DoFn` should occur outside the evaluator, but I could be mistaken. Not totally sure how that jives with your comment.

LGTM to get the big picture setup and forward-fix any little things, but I think Davor will probably want to take a close look.

I believe Travis-CI failures are memory/performance issues in `InProcessPipelineRunner` not related to this PR, since there are no code changes here.

Hi Max,
Next time, to simplify the tracking, do you mind to:
- add the Jira ID in each commit comment (like [BEAM-xxx] ...) ?
- squash in one unique commit when possible.

Thanks !

Via @lukecwik: instead, this logic should move even further out. A new evaluator should be created whenever a `DoFn` would be cloned anyhow, so there's no need to abstract this into a supplier, but just move the cloning out to the `ParDoMultiEvaluatorFactory`, etc. I will combine that smaller change directly into my GBK PR.
Minor wording comments, then LGTM
Rebased to kick the tests.

Though @dhalperi is the expert/owner here, I am going to go ahead and say LGTM and merge. This is more of a Java question. All readers are `AutoCloseable` hence usable in try-with-resources. If `close()` is to be required to be idempotent, the interface for that is `Closeable`. Without that, it is generally erroneous to call `close()` twice. We might javadoc something different, but there's no reason to press it here.
Looks mostly good. Advance LGTM.
Based on advance LGTM I will merge if/when tests are green. Cutting deps and maven properties may have busted something so we'll see.
OK, I've done the same for the Flink runner. Please take a look.

Failure were only with Java 7 JDKs. The PermGen no longer exists in Java 8, so it isn't getting blown. I've adjusted the JVM parameters to settings that will hopefully alleviate the problem. I don't know why this problem does not occur when the runner is part of the SDK.
I've addressed all feedback so far. Please take another look. @bjchambers

Rebased onto new runner location.

R: @tgroh 

I'll grab a committer's attention once you have considered this.

@tgroh, is this something you've seen before?

In general, we should strive that this works on anybody's workstation, and Travis environment might be a good proxy of that.
PTAL

This is a great improvement!

Separately, I think we should think about build speed and potentially adjust plugins to make sure things are optimized for the development workflow, while the CI tools execute everything. We can defer this to a later point.

Agree with Kenn. We could make the case that `Closeable` is a better interface for readers to implement, but given the future of sources this seems low reward.

Please backport if needed, @tgroh

Sure! If you look at my previous commits, you can see those were backed by JIRA issues. The commits in this PR are soon to be removed fixes as long as we don't have all the IO available in Beam. I figured we wouldn't need a JIRA issue here. Should probably open one next time although I see many small fixes in the master which are not backed by issues. I squashed all the commits which introduced independent changes.
No worries at all ! Thanks again ! Much appreciated.
